revision.comment: Remove blank line(s) between list items per [[WP:LISTGAP]] to fix an accessibility issue for users of [[screen reader]]s. Do [[WP:GENFIXES]] and cleanup if needed. Discuss this at [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Accessibility#LISTGAP]]
revision.text:
{{for|crystallographic notation system|Hermannâ€“Mauguin notation}} '''FDI World Dental Federation notation''' is widely used by dentists internationally to associate information to a specific tooth.<ref>[http://www.fdiworldental.org/resources/5_0notation.html FDI Two-Digit Notation], hosted on the [http://www.fdiworldental.org FDI World dental Federation] website. Page accessed April 1, 2007.</ref>
Developed by the [[FDI World Dental Federation]], World Dental Federation notation is also known as ISO 3950<ref>[http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=41835 ISO 3950:2009 ''Dentistry — Designation system for teeth and areas of the oral cavity'']</ref> notation.
Orientation of the chart is traditionally "dentist's view", i.e. patient's right corresponds to notation chart left. The designations "left" and "right" on the chart below correspond to the patient's left and right.
==Table of codes== [[File:Impacted wisdom teeth.jpg|thumb|upright=2.0|X-ray of the teeth and jaw showing the normal permanent teeth. The last two teeth on the patient's left (the dentist's right), 28 and 38 - the maxillary and mandibular third molars (popularly the upper and lower wisdom teeth) are severely impacted.]]
{| class="wikitable" |+ FDI two-digit notation |- ! colspan=16 align="center"| [[Permanent teeth]] |- ! colspan=8 align="center"| patient's upper right !! colspan=8 align="center"| patient's upper left |- |18||17||16||15||14||13||12||11||21||22||23||24||25||26||27||28 |- |48||47||46||45||44||43||42||41||31||32||33||34||35||36||37||38 |- ! colspan=8 align="center"| patient's lower right !! colspan=8 align="center"| patient's lower left |- | colspan=16 align="center"| |- ! colspan=16 align="center"| [[Deciduous teeth]] (baby teeth) |- ! colspan=8 align="center"| upper right !! colspan=8 align="center"| upper left |- | || || ||55||54||53||52||51||61||62||63||64||65|| || || |- | || || ||85||84||83||82||81||71||72||73||74||75|| || || |- ! colspan=8 align="center"| lower right !! colspan=8 align="center"| lower left |}
Codes, names, and usual number of roots: (see chart of teeth at Wikipedia entry: Universal Numbering System)
*11 21 51 61 [[maxillary central incisor]] 1 *41 31 81 71 [[mandibular central incisor]] 1 *12 22 52 62 [[maxillary lateral incisor]] 1 *42 32 82 72 [[mandibular lateral incisor]] 1 *13 23 53 63 [[maxillary canine]] 1 *43 33 83 73 [[mandibular canine]] 1 *14 24 [[maxillary first premolar]] 2 *44 34 [[mandibular first premolar]] 1 *15 25 [[maxillary second premolar]] 1 *45 35 [[mandibular second premolar]] 1 *16 26 54 64 [[maxillary first molar]] 3 *46 36 84 74 [[mandibular first molar]] 2 *17 27 55 65 [[maxillary second molar]] 3 *47 37 85 75 [[mandibular second molar]] 2 *18 28 [[maxillary third molar]] 3 *48 38 [[mandibular third molar]] 2
==How the codes are constructed==
Syntax: <quadrant code><tooth code>
''Sometimes a dot is inserted between quadrant code and tooth code in order to avoid ambiguity with other numbering systems''.
{| |----- | {| class="wikitable" |+ Quadrant codes |- |1||upper right permanent teeth |- |2||upper left permanent teeth |- |3||lower left permanent teeth |- |4||lower right permanent teeth |- |5||upper right deciduous teeth |- |6||upper left deciduous teeth |- |7||lower left deciduous teeth |- |8||lower right deciduous teeth |} | width="20" | || {| class="wikitable" |+ Tooth codes |- |1||central incisors |- |2||lateral incisors |- |3||canines |- |4||1st premolars (permanent teeth) / 1st molar (deciduous teeth) |- |5||2nd premolars (permanent teeth) / 2nd molar (deciduous teeth) |- |6||1st molars (permanent teeth) |- |7||2nd molars (permanent teeth) |- |8||3rd molars (permanent teeth) |} |}
Examples: *"13" = permanent upper right canine *"32" = permanent lower left lateral incisor
==See also== * [[Dental notation]] * [[Universal numbering system (dental)|Universal numbering system]] * [[Palmer notation]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.drbunn.com/faq/tooth-numbering Dr.Bunn page on dental notations].
